title: Fix top-of-page personal photo placeholder not showing uploaded image

requirements.text: Ensure the user-provided personal photo renders visibly in the top-of-page placeholder on the Valentine proposal page by fixing the static asset reference and build/deploy asset availability for the file path currently used: /assets/generated/personal-photo.dim_1600x1600.png.

quotes: there is a placeholder on the top of the page it was not visible during upload as well

acceptanceCriteria: On page load, the personal photo area at the top shows the actual image (not an empty frame/placeholder).
The browser network panel shows the personal photo request returns HTTP 200 (no 404/failed request) for /assets/generated/personal-photo.dim_1600x1600.png.
No console errors occur related to failing to load the personal photo asset.

requirements.text: Add robust client-side handling for the personal photo element so that if the image cannot load, the UI does not show a broken/empty placeholder; instead, render a clear fallback state in the photo frame with English text indicating the photo is unavailable.

quotes: there is a placeholder on the top of the page it was not visible during upload as well

acceptanceCriteria: If the personal photo fails to load (simulated by pointing to an invalid URL), the photo container shows a fallback (no broken image icon).
Fallback copy is in English and is readable on both mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Audit the Valentine proposal page UI to confirm there is no remaining in-app upload/preview flow, and that the userâ€™s personal photo is only displayed as a fixed static asset at the top of the page.

quotes: there is a placeholder on the top of the page it was not visible during upload as well

acceptanceCriteria: There is no visible photo upload control or upload preview UI on the page.
The only personal photo shown is the fixed static asset displayed in the top photo frame.

constraints: Do not add or rely on any backend logic; the backend must remain unchanged.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
The personal photo must remain a static frontend asset referenced by the existing public URL path (/assets/generated/personal-photo.dim_1600x1600.png).
nonGoals: Adding user accounts, storage, or a real upload feature.
Changing the Valentine page copy, animations, or the No-button behavior beyond what is required to fix the photo visibility issue.
